page.title: 15BIGLAND WILDLIFE-HOLKER MOSS
page.content: The wooded upland around{Bigland {Tarn}has a variety of environments and a large range of wildlife. {Bigland Tarn}covers 4.5 hectares and contains unpolluted water of ph 6.5. It is roughly circular in shape and up to 11m. deep.Reeds and lilies are common around its banks.Fish include perch,pike,roach,eels and carp. The wood and moorland around the tarn are the habitat for many different species of birds.Buzzards nest on the higher ground where crows and magpies can also be seen.Coots and ducks occupy the area near the tarn and a variety of smaller birds can be seen in the woodland. The woods are made up mostly of oak, birch,hawthorn and some conifers.Apart from grazing sheep the animal life includes rabbits,voles,fallow deer and adders.
